pr_title: Issue 4570: (KeyValue Tables) Client Data Path Implementation

timeline.message:
Refactored TableSegment, TableEntry, TableKey in preparation for creating KeyValueTable. Moved a few classes around.

Refactored SegmentHelper to make use of TableSegmentKey, TableSegmentEntry and TableSegmentKeyVersion which better map to what a Table Segment can do. Refactored upstream code and adjusted unit tests.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@dell.com>

Javadoc.
Moved IteratorItem into its own file.

timeline.bodyText: I thought the key family + the key had to be under 8kb. If this is true on the server, I think from a public interface perspective it makes sense to limit each to 4kb to simplify the model for users. (IE there isn't a failure mode where you change the key family, and a key that was previously ok now has an error)
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText: Good catch. I actually wanted to make it more restrictive, but I forgot. I restricted this to 1KB for now. It will always be easier to increase the limit than shrink it in the future.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.bodyText: We should probably use a normal long. Segment ids are highly probably > 2^32 and are not guarenteed to not use the full range of numbers.
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText:
CompactLong goes from 0 until 2^62.
I thought they were sequential, but if they could be arbitrary, then we should probably handle -2^63 to 2^63.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText:
#4656  has a branch with all the changes. I can't submit that PR until I get this one in since they clash on a few files - including this one.
We'll have to do them in sequence, and I chose to do this PR first. Yes, the functionality will be broken until #4656 is done, but that's why I'm pushing into a feature branch.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.bodyText: There is a new way you added to do this which is probably better, let's be sure when the merge is resolved we are using that.
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText: Yes, this branch is still forked off feature-key-value-tables which hasn't been updated in a long time.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

replies.bodyText: Merged with master; this should be fixed now.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.bodyText: Ideally we could avoid this copy...
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText: Interesting. I originally did that because I wanted to implement Serializer<String>. I didn't need that so I made this use ByteBufs.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.message:
KeyFamilySerializer uses ByteBuf. Also restricting max length to 1KB.
Fixed a potential bug in KeyValueTableIteratorState.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText: Just to confirm, the tests pass if this is 1 right?

replies.bodyText: Yes they do. But the tests run somewhat faster with 3 given that at least in one implementation of this class we run the entire segment store.
